radiographic_examinations.findings: Bone mineral density (BMD) Z-score of -19.9 in the L1-L4 spine and -15.0 in the dual total femurs. Corresponding BMD measurements were 2.342 and 1.586 g/cm2.

Characteristic findings of skeletal fluorosis including diffuse osteosclerosis, sparse and coarsened trabeculae, thoracic kyphosis, soft tissue calcification, and ossification. No fractures or diaphyseal expansions.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Observations were typical of phase 3 skeletal fluorosis, indicating more advanced ligamentous calcification than previously reported.

radiographic_examinations.findings: Demonstrated a 'superscan' with increased skeletal radioisotope uptake relative to soft tissues and absence of activity in the kidneys. Increased uptake in the periarticular regions of the knees and ankles.
